Collections.CollectionTitle: Oxyrhynchus Papyri in the Ambrose Swasey Library.
Collections.CollectionDescription:
Images of the 29 Oxyrhynchus Papyri held by the Ambrose Swasey Library of the Colgate Rochester Crozer Divinity School. These Greek papyrus fragments date from the 1st to the 5th centuries A.D. Included are scriptural texts, personal letters, and legal instruments such as leases, contracts, and tax receipts, as well as early Christian writings and documents relating to Egyptian pagan religions.
Oxyrhynchus, a Greek-speaking district capital of the Roman Empire, was located on the Nile near the modern-day village of Bahnasa, Egypt, 125 miles south of Cairo. The dry climate proved an ideal preservative for these papyri, which document the social, religious, and administrative life of a late imperial city. However these are but a fraction of the mass of manuscripts recovered from Oxyrhynchus.
Thousands of these papyri were unearthed by British papyrologists Bernard P. Grenfell and Arthur S. Hunt, between 1893 and 1908, on expeditions sponsored by the Egypt Exploration Fund. These papyri are commonly known by the numbers and titles assigned by their discoverers, and have been published in the catalog which, at volume 67, remains a work in progress of the Egypt Exploration Society. For transcriptions of the texts or additional information on these papyri the viewer is referred to that catalog: Bernard P. Grenfell, and Arthur S. Hunt, et al., eds., The Oxyrhynchus Papyri. (London: Egypt Exploration Fund, 1898- ). For additional information on the images, contact the Ambrose Swasey Library of the Colgate Rochester Crozer Divinity School, Rochester, New York.
Collections.CollectionSource: Digitized from Ektachrome transparencies of the Oxyrhynchus Papyri in the collection of the Ambrose Swasey Library, Colgate Rochester Crozer Divinity School.
Collections.CollectionDataNote: Digital images: JPEG format, 150 dpi, 24 bit color.

Components.ComponentTitle: P. Oxy. 1256: List of priests under age.
Components.ComponentDescription: List of underage persons of priestly descent who perform priestly functions in the temples of Anubis and Leto. Compiled by two comarchs of the Cynopolite village of Laura, for the archives of the Cynopolite nome. Dated CE 282. Published in Oxyrhynchus Papyri v. 10, no. 1256; Cherry, p. 102. JPG file (263 KB)
Components.ComponentSource: Digitized from Ektachrome transparencies of a manuscript in the collection of the Ambrose Swasey Library, Colgate Rochester Crozer Divinity School. 1 leaf, papyrus, 21.5 x 9.5 cm., mounted in glass 31 x 23 cm.
Components.Collection: Oxyrhynchus Papyri in the Ambrose Swasey Library.

Components.ComponentTitle: P. Oxy. 1265: Affidavit of priestly rank.
Components.ComponentDescription: Affidavit sworn by Aurelius Thonius, priest of the temple of Zeus and Hera, certifying that his rank was acquired by hereditary succession from his father Demetrius. Addressed by Thonius to Flavius Paranius, logistes of the Oxyrhynchite nome. Dated CE 336. Published in Oxyrhynchus Papyri v. 10, no. 1265; Cherry, p. 134. JPG file (261 KB)
Components.ComponentSource: Digitized from Ektachrome transparencies of a manuscript in the collection of the Ambrose Swasey Library, Colgate Rochester Crozer Divinity School. 1 leaf, papyrus, 23.5 x 8.6 cm., mounted in glass 31 x 23 cm.
Components.Collection: Oxyrhynchus Papyri in the Ambrose Swasey Library.

Components.ComponentDescription: A misspelled and crudely written letter of Peter to his mother Maria, containing greetings to his brethren and requesting four articles of winter apparel and some rings. 5th century. Published in Oxyrhynchus Papyri v. 10, no. 1300; Cherry, p. 156. JPG file (380 KB)
Components.ComponentSource: Digitized from Ektachrome transparencies of a manuscript in the collection of the Ambrose Swasey Library, Colgate Rochester Crozer Divinity School. 1 leaf, papyrus, 9.9 x 31.1 cm., mounted in glass 23 x 36 cm.
Components.Collection: Oxyrhynchus Papyri in the Ambrose Swasey Library.
